message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) as it deals with automatic speech recognition (ASR) and the use of joint articulatory and acoustic features for ASR. It could also belong to the sub-category of Sound and Music Computing (cs.SD) as it deals with speech processing and recognition. Additionally, it could be categorized under Machine Learning (cs.LG) as it uses neural network architectures for ASR. It may also fall under Signal Processing (cs.SI) as it deals with processing of speech signals. Finally, it could belong to Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) as it uses neural networks for ASR.
